title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.4 - Measurement
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.4 - Measurement

State Regulations
(a) Hydrogen
sulfide is determined by the methods acceptable to the commissioner and
expressed as parts of hydrogen sulfide per million parts of ambient air (ppm)
by volume. (b) All measurements are
corrected to a reference temperature of 25 degrees Centigrade and to a
reference pressure of 760 millimeters of mercury. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
257-5.4

Renumbered from 257-10.4

New

York State Register November 27, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 48, eff. 12/7/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
